In order to test the accuracy, a common procedure for MD simulations of a canonical ensemble [ 43, 44] was employed to produce the internal energy of the 2D materials in contact with a thermal bath at a given temperature T. Specifically, the atoms of the substrate ( Figure 1) were fixed while the C atoms moved according to classical equations of motion, which were solved by the Verlet algorithm with a time step of 0.2 fs. Within the first 400 fs, all the carbon atoms were assigned velocities every 40 fs according to the Maxwell velocity distribution at temperature T, and then, the internal energy (

) and the temperature were recorded every 30 fs to perform the average over 100 records.
